.. |ortholog| replace:: unknown

snRcnag12093
============

.. figure:: /../_static/images/snoRNAs/cnag12093_h99_igb.png
   :name: cnag12093_h99_igb
   :align: left
   :width: 1389 px
   :height: 646 px
   :scale: 40%
   :figwidth: 100%

- snRcnag12093_intronic-boxCDsnoRNA-83nt
- From dedicated transcript like CNAG_12093 opposite of *CAS31* (CNA06800, CNAG_00701) coding for "CAP64 gene product-related")
- Clear homologues were not retrieved for *Kwoniella* species (apart from *K.*\ |nbsp|\ *shandongensis*), nor for *C.*\ |nbsp|\ *skinneri*.
- Predicted target: |target|
- Putative targets are uncertain given that only a short stretch of complimentarity can be expected while the conservation of the snoRNA guide is not reflected in that of the putative target sites in many of the checked species (:doc:`snrcnag12093-species`).
- Conservation in snRcnag12093 appears quite extensive and could facilitate base pairing to |targetRNA|

.. - Orthologue of |ortholog|

.. figure:: /../_static/images/snoRNAs/cnag12093-align.png
   :name: cnag12093-align
   :align: left
   :width: 1636 px
   :height: 437 px
   :scale: 40%
   :figwidth: 100%

|




Targets of snRcnag12903?
''''''''''''''''''''''''

No obvious :doc:`complimentary methylation sites <../18s-tab>` can be found for the guide in snRcnag12093. What are the other RNAs for this snoRNA to interact with? Would putative associations be consistent with the degree of its conservation and that of the guide sequence? Putative targets were searched for with |targetRNA|, composed from ambiguous nucleotides. This yielded a list of :doc:`loci with complementarity <snrcnag12093-targets>` of 14 nt or longer to the methylation guide of snR12093.

- The tentative target of snRcnag12093 in 5S rRNA only supports 9 base-pairs and seems not sufficiently conserved (e.g. in *Tremella* or *Vanrija*) to suggest that this interaction is kept during evolution.

.. figure:: /../_static/images/snoRNAs/5S-align.png
   :name: 5s-align
   :align: left
   :width: 1222 px
   :height: 515 px
   :scale: 40%
   :figwidth: 100%

|
|

-  Target for snR12093 is only present in *Cryptococcus* ITS2 (shown in pre-rRNA with conserved 5.8S and 25S rRNA flanks; the secondary structure fits the 'ring-pin' model [Coleman-2015_, Burlacu-2017_]). 

.. figure:: /../_static/images/snoRNAs/ITS2-align.png
   :name: its2-align
   :align: left
   :width: 1314 px
   :height: 407 px
   :scale: 40%
   :figwidth: 100%

|
|


- Retaining the first intron in L30e in H99 (and JEC21) could be controlled by snRcnag12093 base-pairing upstream of the branchpoint (*CTGA*).

  | Other intron interactions, with the 3' splice sites in `CNF00560, CNAG_05919`_ or `CNB05690, CNAG_04090`_, could have an effect on intron skipping as well.
  | A possible effect of the snoRNA on splicing in JEC21 or H99 is also suggested by base-pairing quite close to 5' splice sites in the case of `CNM01110, CNAG_06104`_, `CNL06520, CNAG_04963`_, `CNL04310, CNAG_07641?`_, or `CNN00150, CNAG_06259`_.

:raw-html:`<table><tr><th>&nbsp;<i>C.&nbsp;neoformans</i></th><th>&nbsp;</th><th><i>Tremellomycetes</i> L30e intron</th>`

.. _`CNA02220, CNAG_00232`:

:raw-html:`<tr><td>`

   
.. figure:: /../_static/images/snoRNAs/cnag12093-overlap1_h99_igb.png
   :name: cnag12093-1
   :align: left
   :width: 1389 px
   :height: 646 px
   :scale: 30%

:raw-html:`</td><td>&nbsp;</td><td>`

.. figure:: /../_static/images/snoRNAs/L30-align.png
   :name: cna02220-align
   :align: left
   :width: 2401 px
   :height: 346 px
   :scale: 30%

   CNA02220, CNAG_00232

:raw-html:`</td></tr></table>`

- A well-expressed target lies in an exon of the conserved gene for riboflavin synthase (`CNC06150, CNAG_03004`_), but support for base-pairing to snRcnag12093 is gone at the homologous position in distant genes.
- Unless this would be related to an inhibitory effect of snoRNA base-pairing, many targets are not highly expressed nor sufficiently conserved to suggest an interaction with snRcnag12093, i.e. those encoding a vacuolar protein (`CNC02600, CNAG_01759`_), a nuclear protein (`CNA06080, CNAG_02998`_), a vacuolar membrane protein (`CND01900, CNAG_01059`_), a HAD hydrolase (`CNE04600, CNAG_02046`_), a regulator (`CNF00560, CNAG_05919`_), an essential protein (`CNF02580, CNAG_05716`_), a protein with an RNA PolII assembly factor domain (`CNA00860, CNAG_00095`_), Myo-inositol transporters (`CNH03060, CNAG_00867`_ etc.), endopeptidase (`CNK02700, CNAG_01930`_), white collar 1 protein (`CNL04450, CNAG_05181`_), a beta-glucuronidase C-terminal domain-containing protein (`CNM01110, CNAG_06104`_), DNA replication factor (intron, `CNN00630, CNAG_06333`_), b-zip transcription factor (intron, 3'splice site junction, `CNB05690, CNAG_04090`_), unknown protein (intron, only in  `CNC02870, not CNAG_01796`_), a hydrolase (`CNL06520, CNAG_04963`_), CSC1/OSCA1-like 7TM-domain-containing protein (`CNB01000, CNAG_03597`_), an importin-alpha-export receptor (`CNC02070, CNAG_07598`_), or transporters (`CNL04310, CNAG_07641?`_, `CNN00150, CNAG_06259`_). Some loci are only found for JEC21 and H99 (`CNA08150, CNAG_00838`_, or `CNH02350, CNAG_05590`_) or only JEC21 (`opposite CNB02995`_, `CNH01277, not CNAG_05467`_).


- Genomic context of putative targets in *C. neoformans* and alignment with homologous sequences found in :doc:`snrcnag12093-species` [#loc]_:
